name: Raise the ceiling on foreign institutional investment in government bonds
Fully privatize Air India
Create a structured and time-bound out-of-court restructuring process to prevent a bottleneck of the NCLT
Improve the functioning of the NCLT by increasing the number of benches and increasing the timeline for resolution of cases to one year
Fill all judicial vacancies in India's courts
Release an annual report every year outlining the origin country and destination state of foreign investment into India

not_started.description: India's FDI data currently shows only the last point of departure for FDI (usually Mauritius or Singapore), and the city foreign investment applications are filed in (Delhi or Mumbai).

completed.description: The Reserve Bank of India and/or Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade releases an annual report providing details on the origin country and destination state of FDI into India

name: Create a bankruptcy resolution process for financial firms

not_started.description: Financial institutions have been kept out of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code's purview

incomplete.description: A bill creating a bankruptcy resolution process for financial firms is approved by Parliament, but underlying regulations are not issued or contain critical weaknesses

completed.description: The law creating a bankruptcy process for financial firms is passed in Parliament and signed into law by the President of India, and related regulations are issued

name: Place control of pricing of electrical power in the hands of the central government

not_started.description: State-level tariff-setting bodies have been unable to balance political interests and consumer requirements to deliver reasonably-priced power.

incomplete.description: The center and states reach an agreement to jointly determine pricing of electrical power in India

completed.description: The center amends the Electricity Act and assumes complete control of pricing of electrical power in India

name: Pass the Major Port Authorities Bill

not_started.description: Major ports currently face strict regulations from the government on rates, decision-making, and governance

incomplete.description: The Major Port Authorities bill is reintroduced in Parliament

completed.description: The Major Port Authorities Bill is passed in Parliament and signed into law by the President of India

name: End retrospective taxation of cross-border investments

not_started.description: While the government created a committee under the Central Board of Direct Taxes to block retrospective taxation of cross-border investments, it has not amended the Income Tax Code to repeal the provision entirely

incomplete.description: A bill is introduced in Parliament amending the Income Tax Code to repeal the retrospective taxation of cross-border investments entirely

completed.description: Parliament passes an act ending retrospective taxation of cross-border investments and the act is signed into law by the President of India

name: Reduce the corporate tax rate from 30 percent to 25 percent

not_started.description: India's 30 percent corporate tax rate is among the highest in the world.

incomplete.description: A bill is introduced in Parliament reducing the corporate tax rate from 30 percent to 25 percent

completed.description: Parliament passes an act reducing the corporate tax rate to 25 percent, and the act is signed into law by the President of India

name: Stop forcing banks to lend to "priority sectors"

not_started.description: The Reserve Bank of India currently forces bank to allocate 40% of their credit to priority sectors

incomplete.description: The Reserve Bank of India reduces the stipulation to below 40% or allows more flexibility in the discharge of these obligations, but stops short of abolishing the practice entirely

completed.description: The Reserve Bank of India removes its stipulation that banks should allocate a certain percentage to priority sectors.

name: Reduce restrictions on multi-brand retail

not_started.description: Foreign direct investment in multi-brand retail is subject to minimum investment size, sourcing rules and location limitations

completed.description: The government issues a Press Note lifting all restrictions on minimum investment size, sourcing rules and location limitation for multi-brand retail

name: Amend or replace the Fair Compensation in Land Acquisition Act to simplify the time and cost required to acquire land

not_started.description: The Fair Compensation in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation, and Resettlement Act, 2013 requires that states obtain approval from at least 80% of residents before buying land, making it difficult to find plots for industry and infrastructure

incomplete.description: The government reintroduces the The Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement (Amendment) Bill which simplifies the time needed and the cost required to acquire land in India

completed.description: Parliament passes the The Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition, Rehabilitation and Resettlement (Amendment) Bill, and is signed into law by the President of India

name: Mandate regulatory bodies to issue cost/benefit analyses, as well as a 30-day notice and comment period, for all proposed regulation

not_started.description: Regulations are implemented without a 30-day notice and comment period, and released without a cost-benefit analysis

incomplete.description: India's Ministry of Law and Justice or the Indian Cabinet issues note calling on government agencies to honor a 30-day notification period, and issue a cost-benefit analysis

completed.description: Parliament passes statutes amending the laws governing Indiaâ€™s financial regulators, mandating a 30-day notice and comment period for proposed regulation and the issuance of a cost-benefit analysis

name: Deregulate Kerosene Pricing
Deregulate Natural Gas Pricing

not_started.description: While the government has taken steps to introduce profit-sharing in natural gas production, the government has still implemented price ceilings on natural gas, maintaining control of pricing

completed.description: The government issues a new Hydrocarbon policy that removes the government from pricing of natural gas, allowing the market to set the price

name: Allow more than 50% investment in Insurance

not_started.description: Only 49% foreign investment is currently allowed, with minority ownership for the foreign firm

incomplete.description: The government introduces amendments to Insurance Act that allow foreign investment above 50% but does not lift minority ownership regulations

completed.description: Parliament passes amendments to the Insurance Act allowing more than 50% investment and lifting minority ownership regulations, which are then signed into law

name: Allow more than 50% investment in direct retail e-commerce

not_started.description: Foreign direct investment in direct business-to-consumer retail e-commerce is not allowed unless items are all being sold under a single brand, meet local-content requirements, and the inventory is not owned or controlled by the foreign company

completed.description: The government issues a Press Note allowing more than 50% FDI in the retail e-commerce, and removes all restrictions on direct retail e-commerce companies

name: Allow more than 50% investment in Defense

not_started.description: FDI above 50% in defense is currently subject to approval from the government

completed.description: The government issues a Press Note lifting the cap on FDI in the defense sector

name: Simplify the Goods and Services Tax rates to three rates

not_started.description: The current rate structure of four rates, plus a separate tax rate for gold and a 0 percent rate, is overly complicated and should be simplified

incomplete.description:
* Reduced to 5 rates, including a 0 percent rate
* Reduced to 4 rates, including a 0 percent rate

completed.description: Reduced to 3 rates, including a 0 percent rate

name: Include electricity, oil and gas, real estate, and alcohol in the ambit of the GST

not_started.description: While nearly 1300 goods and 500 services are covered by the GST, electricity, oil and gas, real estate, and alcohol are not currently in the ambit of the tax

incomplete.description: Some of the listed products are added into the ambit of the GST, but not all are included

completed.description: All products listed above are included in the ambit of the GST

name: Establish a 10-Year Reform Action Plan to privatize central and state-owned public sector enterprises

not_started.description: The government continues a piecemeal approach to privatization of government-owned companies with no deadline on completion

incomplete.description: The government announces its intent to privatize government-owned companies within 10 years

completed.description: The government releases a 10-Year Action Plan to privatize government-owned companies

name: Privatize India's public sector banks, and create an independent body that decides board appointments to these banks

not_started.description: The government continues to hold a majority stake in public sector banks, and the Ministry of Finance makes all appointments to bank boards

incomplete.description: The government begins steps to merge India's banks, or privatize certain banks, but falls short of complete privatization and independent appointments to bank boards

completed.description: The government reduces its stake in all public sector banks to a minority share, and shifts all power to appoint members of bank boards to the Banks Board Bureau

not_started.description: The long-standing 10% limit on single institutional investors hinders investment in high-growth Indian companies

incomplete.description: 5/15/2020: The RBI reduces the stipulation to below 40%, but stops short of abolishing the practice entirely, or allows more flexibility in the discharge of these obligations

completed.description: SEBI increases the ceiling on foreign institutional investment in Indian companies above 10 percent

name: Raise the ceiling on foreign institutional investment in Indian companies

not_started.description: The government takes no steps to institute the Rail Development Authority despite Cabinet approval

incomplete.description:
* Reduced to 4 rates
* Reduced to 3 rates

completed.description: The government creates the Rail Development Authority

name: Establish the already-approved Rail Development Authority

not_started.description: The government announced the launch of the Integrated Case Management Information System to digitize India's courts, but has so far been implemented only in the Supreme Court

incomplete.description: The Integrated Case Management Information System is implemented is expanded beyond the Supreme Court, but not all courts

completed.description: The Integrated Case Management Information System is implemented in all courts, including the Supreme Court, all High Courts, and all district courts around India to create a truly paperless court system

name: Establish a paperless court system to ensure speedy resolution of cases

not_started.description: According to the World Bank's Ease of Doing Busines Report 2019, it takes 17 days to start a business in India, more than the average of 13.7 days in South Asia

completed.description: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade ensures central government permits are issued within 10 days for all sectors

name: Ensure that business owners can receive central government permits in 10 days or less

not_started.description: The World Bank's Ease of Doing Business Report 2019 notes that it requires 10 procedures to start a business in India, compared to the South Asia regional average of 7.6 procedures

incomplete.description: A financial resolution bill is approved by Parliament, but underlying regulations are not issued or contain critical weaknesses

completed.description: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade ensures the creation of a single-window clearance entity for central government clearances for all sectors

name: Make it easier to start a business by offering one-stop shopping for central government clearances

not_started.description: The Industrial Disputes Act sets a floor of 100 employees after which government permission is required to lay off workers.

incomplete.description: An amendment to the Industrial Dipustes Act to increase the number from 100 is passed in Parliament, but the cap is not eliminated entirely

completed.description: An amendment to the Industrial Disputes Act to remove the cap is passed in Parliament and signed into law by the President of India

name: Remove the requirement for government permission for layoffs in the Industrial Disputes Act
